About the "Nevertired Method"
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher Advance 2 Archive (GameBoy Advance): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): About the "Nevertired Method"
By Gizmo the Lemur on Wednesday, January 22, 2003 - 07:51 am:

...It's a cool method, but how is the stress level of the monster when I load, and save my game constantly? I know if you reload the game a couple of times it wil feel rejuvenated, but I want to be sure if this method also helps reduce your monsters stress.

By GoldenBoy on Wednesday, January 22, 2003 - 09:03 am:

I thought I had a post in that thread about how it seems to work, but it got deleted when it was moved??? L

The Save/Reload essentially reapplies your item bonuses each time you complete a cycle. So if you have a stress reducing item, it will work again and again.

Here's the breakdown:
1. week begins->
2. Items applied->
3. status message displayed
4. SAVE
5. LOAD

The process begins again at step1 but with the stress/tiredness values from step 4. It modifies those and improves them again.

By Gizmo the Lemur on Wednesday, January 22, 2003 - 11:54 am:

By GoldenBoy on Wednesday, January 22, 2003 - 12:02 pm:

no its fine gizmo.
If it had been FAQ I'd have pointed you to the proper place to read the info

By Lisa Shock on Wednesday, January 22, 2003 - 12:55 pm:

The only time I have had stress problems with it has been when I was lazy, and only re-loaded until I saw "pretty lively" for the first time. Then, after doing a week of drilling, the monster usually gets a stress warning on top of the tiredness level. (Ok, with a light drill it won't say the word tired if you have all the durables. I am just calling them tiredness levels because I have managed to get stress warnings on top of all of them, including "really energetic".) My best stretches without stress have been when I re-loaded until I saw the "really energetic" notice a second time. If you stick with that, everything is fine.

I strongly suspect that the stress is relieved by items differently than fatigue, and there are clues to it all (stress and fatigue values of drills and the effects of durables) in re-loading, if anyone has time to reserahc it more. I may do a little work on it, in between doing lifespans, just to keep from going nuts!

By GoldenBoy on Wednesday, January 22, 2003 - 01:10 pm:

Stress is less noticeable mainly because there is a masking effect from fatigue. When your monster is less fatigued, it can be stressed and you'll never know.

By Lisa Shock on Wednesday, January 22, 2003 - 01:19 pm:

Yeah, it's a lot like the lifespan index from MR2.

By Thorr on Thursday, January 23, 2003 - 12:13 pm:

I have noticed that when using this method, my monster gets FAT and GLUTTON. I start the cycle Normal and without glutton. By the time I get just shy of Energetic, my monster becomes FAT and acquires the Glutton trait.

The worst thing about this is that my monster ends up training poorly once I have him at energetic stage.

Can anyone else check this out and confirm what's happening??

-Thorr

By GoldenBoy on Thursday, January 23, 2003 - 12:54 pm:

the only thing I can think of is this:

Possibly if you feed them an snack, it may get applied multiple times too.

I have noticed my monsters going to Indulgent and pampered at times. And it may have been on cycles where I tossed in a minst candy or something.

Its hard to say, I have never had Glutton come back like that myself. Only the other form of spoiling.

There is no known item that modifies food value so this is my only guess.

By Thorr on Friday, January 24, 2003 - 07:03 am:

Of course, the worst part is that it happens when the Load part occurs, which means that I can't avoid it.

-Thorr

By Extremezan on Sunday, February 2, 2003 - 06:50 pm:

i tried it and for some reason it wont work for me i saved/reloaded aroun 15 times and my monster is still really worn out.. do i have to turn my gameboy off then restart or do it all in the ranch? and do you have to redo like every new week?.. i know im asking alot of questions so sorry.

By GoldenBoy on Sunday, February 2, 2003 - 08:11 pm:

If you don't have the best durable items then the effect is nonexistent.
It works because it repeatedly applies the effects of these items, like Holy Cup, Bright Gem, etc. If you don't have the stuff, nothing will happen.

By Extremezan on Sunday, February 2, 2003 - 08:14 pm:

do you have to have each of those or just one because i dont have much money

By GoldenBoy on Sunday, February 2, 2003 - 09:05 pm:

each item you get will adds its effect when you use the method (not multiples of the same).


read about Charm if you need to buy stuff and are low on cash. (characteristics section)

By Anonymous on Saturday, February 22, 2003 - 08:54 am:

Another note on the Overload method: Do it too much and your data corrupts. I had almost everything, but I Overloaded too much and the file corrupted. In other words, it wouldn't load, so I had to start all over again.

By GoldenBoy on Saturday, February 22, 2003 - 10:20 am:

By Dmonsters on Wednesday, February 26, 2003 - 02:52 pm:

just about how many loads does it take from tire or worn out to energetic

By Lisa Shock on Wednesday, February 26, 2003 - 03:40 pm:

Wow, don't let your monster get to being 'tired' or 'worn out' especially. I know it's hard after sparring or a venture, but make sure that you are very well before going. Once you see the tired or worn out warning, you have enough stress/fatigue to lose lifespan. With both expensive durables, it takes about three re-loads to raise one level.

By Dmonsters on Wednesday, February 26, 2003 - 04:24 pm:

thanks lisa for the advise and the anwser
